description: Partial demolition and construction of three storey extension (renewal of planning permission ref: 162704OPDFUL)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 6018/1 - Existing Site & Location Plan, 6018/2 - Existing Ground Floor, 6018/3 - Existing First Floor, 6018/4 - Existing Second Floor, 6018/5 - Existing Elevations, 6018/6 - Existing Section, 6018/11 - Proposed Site & Location Plan, 6018/12 - Proposed Ground Floor, 6018/13 - Proposed First Floor, 6018/14 - Proposed Second Floor, 6018/15 - Proposed Elevations, 6018/16 - Proposed Section, Design & Access Statement (ref: 6018) prepared by HDA Architecture dated 24/05/2016

REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | Refuse and recycling storage shall be provided on site in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the commencement of the development and retained permanently.

REASON:  To protect amenity of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and Policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016). | A minimum of 6 long stay and 3 short stay cycle parking spaces shall be shall be provided for the site prior to the first use of the development hereby approved and operated and retained permanently thereafter.

REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for electric vehicle parking within the site in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), and The National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Two disabled car parking bays shall be provided onsite prior to first occupation and shall be permanently retained without obstruction.

REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2016). | No development approved by this planning permission shall be commenced until:

a) A desktop study has been carried out which shall include the identification of previous site uses, potential contaminants that might reasonably be expected given those uses and other relevant information.  And using this information a diagrammatical representation (Conceptual Model) for the site of all potential contaminant sources, pathways and receptors has been produced.

b) A site investigation has been designed for the site using the information obtained from the desktop study and any diagrammatical representations (Conceptual Model).  This should be submitted to, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to that investigation being carried out on the site.  The investigation must be comprehensive enough to enable:
- a risk assessment to be undertaken relating to groundwater and surface waters associated on and off the site that may be affected, and
- refinement of the Conceptual Model, and
- the development of a Method Statement detailing the remediation requirements.
c) The site investigation has been undertaken in accordance with details approved by the Local Planning Authority and a risk assessment has been undertaken.

d) A Method Statement detailing the remediation requirements, including measures to minimise the impact on ground and surface waters, using the information obtained from the Site Investigation has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority.  This should be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to that remediation being carried out on the site.
REASON: To ensure that development on this site does not activate or spread contamination.
